snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio announced a plan to install $100 million worth of alterations and improvements to make buildings in some 300 public housing developments more efficient.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and federal government announce plan to install over $100 million worth of alterations and improvements to make city's public housing buildings more energy efficient.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio announced a plan to install $100 million worth of alterations and improvements to make buildings in some 300 public housing developments more efficient.

headline.main: New York Plans Upgrades for Housing Projects to Reduce Emissions and Utility Costs
headline.print_headline: City Plans Upgrades for Housing Projects to Reduce Gas Emissions and Utility Costs
